content:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/6974

we got a report about the upper_case_acronyms complaining about public interfaces hitting the latest stable release (1.51)
(beta 1.52 and nightly 1.53 are fine). Does this warrant a backport?
of course this is not a "clippy is totally unusable" kind of bug but it can still be pretty annoying I guess :/

there might be a point release anyway so maybe just add it to the pile...? :sweat_smile:
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/241545-t-release/topic/1.2E51.2E1.20point.20release
I'm not sure what the release team thinks
Iff there is a point release, we might as well backport this. Otherwise, this doesn't warrant a point release.

actually as @Joshua Nelson pointed out my previous fix was incomplete... :-/
hopefully will be fixed by https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/6981
